10.text:
Everyone remembers the day they were sent
to see the School Dentist...and the chances

15.text:
are they would have seen that dentist because
their examinations were part of a statutory

21.text:
national screening programme...a programme
that it was estimated in 2010 would have cost

27.text:
the NHS in England a sizeable £17 million
a year.

31.text:
But, research undertaken by our team at the
University of Manchester demonstrated that

38.text:
We could detect no improvements in dental
health or dental visiting patterns at the

43.text:
population level, and found that the programme
was, in fact, likely to increase inequalities

49.text:
in health and service utilisation for children
who were found to have a problem.

54.text:
As a direct result of this University of Manchester
research, the National Screening Committee

59.text:
recommended that the national programme should
stop.

63.text:
This changed Departments of Health policy
and resulted in the issuing of new guidance

70.text:
The new guidance not only stopped the screening
programme, but redirected these "precious"

75.text:
resources into treatment services for vulnerable
groups, and into primary prevention programmes.

82.text:
17 million pounds of public money going to
better serve the public.

88.text: Now that's what I call a positive impact!
